abstract: Supreme Court will hear case Walker v Sons of Confederate Veterans, challenge to Texas decision to refuse to allow license plates that feature Confederate flag; case will consider limits of free expression and the meaning of the flag, which many associate with secession and slavery.
lead_paragraph: On Monday, the Supreme Court will hear a challenge to an appellate ruling that Texas had discriminated against the Sons of Confederate Veterans by rejecting a proposed novelty license plate featuring a Confederate Flag.

headline.main: A Test of Free Speech and Bias, Served on a Plate From Texas
headline.print_headline: A Test of Free Speech and Bias, Served to Court on a Plate From Texas

snippet: On Monday, the Supreme Court will hear a challenge to an appellate ruling that Texas had discriminated against the Sons of Confederate Veterans by rejecting a proposed novelty license plate featuring a Confederate Flag.
